results.title: Haifaa Al-Mansour Rocks Out to Punk and Cooks With TikTok
results.abstract: With her movie “The Perfect Candidate” arriving in American theaters, Al-Mansour, the first Saudi Arabian woman to become a feature-length filmmaker, discusses her cultural essentials.

results.title: A Kevin Spacey Accuser Tried to Sue Anonymously. A Judge Said No.
results.abstract: As sexual assault cases proliferate, judges must weigh accusers’ requests for anonymity against the tradition of open courts and fairness toward defendants.

multimedia.caption: Kevin Spacey attends a 2019 hearing in Nantucket, Mass. Prosecutors dropped a criminal case against Mr. Spacey where it was alleged he groped an 18-year-old man at a Nantucket bar in 2016. It is just one of a series of sexual misconduct allegations against the actor in recent years.

results.title: Norman Lloyd, Associate of Welles, Hitchcock and Others, Dies at 106
results.abstract: He was seen in movies and on TV shows like “St. Elsewhere” and worked with some of the biggest names in show business, even though his own name was little known.

multimedia.caption: Norman Lloyd in the 1942 Alfred Hitchcock movie “Saboteur.” In addition to acting under Hitchcock and Orson Welles, Mr. Lloyd worked with Charlie Chaplin, Bertolt Brecht, John Houseman and Jean Renoir.

Norman Lloyd in the 1942 Alfred Hitchcock movie “Saboteur.” In addition to acting under Hitchcock and Orson Welles, Mr. Lloyd worked with Charlie Chaplin, Bertolt Brecht, John Houseman and Jean Renoir.

results.title: How the Golden Globes Went From Laughingstock to Power Player
results.abstract: The group that was once assailed by the F.C.C. steadily gained influence in Hollywood over the years until scrutiny of its practices and lack of diversity led NBC to say it would not air its show in 2022.
results.byline: By Nicole Sperling and Brooks Barnes

results.title: Tawny Kitaen, Star of 1980s Music Videos, Dies at 59
results.abstract: Ms. Kitaen gained fame for her carefree spirit and sultry dancing in music videos for bands like Whitesnake and Ratt and her role in the movie “Bachelor Party.”

multimedia.caption: Tawny Kitaen in 1998. She was a mainstay on MTV in the 1980s when it was at its peak cultural influence.
multimedia.copyright: Bruce C. Strong/The Orange County Register, via Associated Press
